results.title: Renal artery stenosis towards the year 2000.
results.text_hl: Interim analysis of an ongoing prospective multicentre study in the Netherlands indicates that the prevalence of @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@renal artery stenosis@@@ is as high as 25% in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who are resistant to the combination of 10 mg @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ + 50 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, compared with 15% in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ resistant to the combination of 20 mg @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ + 25 mg @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@.

citations.NLM: Derkx FH, van Jaarsveld BC, Krijnen P, Man in 't Veld AJ, van den Meiracker AH, Schalekamp MA. Renal artery stenosis towards the year 2000. J Hypertens Suppl. 1996 Dec;14(5):S167-72. PMID: 9120674
citations.BibTeX: @article{9120674, title={Renal artery stenosis towards the year 2000.}, author={Derkx FH and van Jaarsveld BC and Krijnen P and Man in 't Veld AJ and van den Meiracker AH and Schalekamp MA}, journal={J Hypertens Suppl}, volume={14}, number={5}, pages={S167-72}}

results.title: Persistence of unilateral secretion and contralateral renin suppression after successful percutaneous transluminal dilatation in a normotensive patient.
results.text_hl: We describe a case of a 26-year old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ with severe @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@fibromuscular renal artery stenosis@@@ whose blood pressure was well controlled with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ but that remained normotensive also after discontinuation of the drug.

citations.NLM: Glorioso N, Dessi' Fulgheri P, Madeddu P, Rappelli A. Persistence of unilateral secretion and contralateral renin suppression after successful percutaneous transluminal dilatation in a normotensive patient. Acta Cardiol. 1982;37(6):451-4. PMID: 6219527
citations.BibTeX: @article{6219527, title={Persistence of unilateral secretion and contralateral renin suppression after successful percutaneous transluminal dilatation in a normotensive patient.}, author={Glorioso N and Dessi' Fulgheri P and Madeddu P and Rappelli A}, journal={Acta Cardiol}, volume={37}, number={6}, pages={451-4}}
